intro: Eulophia lissochiloides, commonly known as the smooth-lip eulophia, is a terrestrial orchid native to Southeast Asia. It features a sympodial growth habit with a short, stocky rhizome and multiple leafy shoots. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow, typically arranged in a spike. Its flowers have a distinctive lip that is smooth and elongated, giving it its common name. Eulophia lissochiloides thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
